summary: “I had lots of time to get used to [the suit] because it was developed, really, on my body. They had a design which got very...
caption: “I had lots of time to get used to [the suit] because it was developed, really, on my body. They had a design which got very complicated. I mean at one point there was a backpack, with two lights that went on, the phosphorescent effects, but they said, ‘Wow, like this is too much. This is too much going on.’” - Willem Dafoe on playing Green Goblin 🎭

summary: CAPTAIN AMERICA: THE FIRST AVENGER
title: CAPTAIN AMERICA: THE FIRST AVENGER
body:
Captain America: The First Avenger is Marvel’s first great movie. Yeah, yeah, yeah, Iron Man is Robot Downey Jr: The Film and it started everything, Thor is Family Fortunes with trolls and shit. But Captain America is an old-fashioned, gung-ho period adventure, where a plucky underdog cracks Nazis in the jaw to a string-laden soundtrack and enough explosions for an explosion factory. And he’s a superhero. If Marvel’s ultimate goal is to make movies that are perfect to watch on a Saturday night with a beer and pizza, then The First Avenger is their first slam dunk.

 It starts, again, with the actors. This movie has an insane, perfect cast, from Tommy Lee Jones chewing up every scene he’s in to Hayley Atwell bursting out of nowhere as the smartest, toughest woman in the whole MCU (which has like five whole women now!). Stanley Tucci is adorable, Hugo Weaving and Toby Jones are the twin queens of camp-Nazi mountain and all the Howling Commandos are delightful gung-ho caricatures. But it’s Chris Evans who made himself a superstar, tackling the toughest role in the whole universe head on and coming out as the best Avenger. His Steve Rogers hasn’t got the snark of Stark or goofy awe of Thor but he makes something much harder work – a decent guy, someone who simply doesn’t like bullies and a straight-edge do-gooder. Yeah, it helps that he got arguably the best movies of the series built around him, but his Cap is so darned likeable and inspiring that within minutes you know he’s the only super worthy of leading the Avengers, and this is all down to Evans and Markus & McFeely, the writers who’d hone and guide him through Winter Soldiers, Civil and Infinity Wars and Endgame. They’re gonna kill him aren’t they. They’re gonna goddamn hell-ass kill him.

On an MCU nerd-level it’s astonishing how much they throw in here: the origins of the fabulous Agent Carter series, Bucky and Howard Stark, the Tesseract and the Skull starring at the World Tree, about to be condemned to an eternity beyond his tiny hate. The movie in isolation’s almost perfect, really; it whips along, the action’s satisfying and old-school, the period trappings are fantastic. But compared to the rest of the MCU it shares an essential quality with the first Avengers, a ‘comic-booky’ style that was dolloped with realism from Phase 2 onwards. It’s old-school comics made flesh, a Saturday matinee spectacular that also serves as the zero-point for so much of the MCU’s overarching narrative.

But it wouldn’t be any of this without heart. That’s the secret. From Steve jumping on the fake grenade to dying Erskine tapping his chest, from losing his best friend off the side of a speeding train to the final, heartbreaking ‘I had a date’, this is a straight-forward, full-hearted movie, the kind they don’t make anymore except when they do. It’s fucking great. And Steve and Bucky are gay as hell.

blog.name: oxymitch
blog.title: Whatever Mitch
blog.description:
I am Mitch of Singapore, also an Ace. I enjoy reading superhero comics (especially Marvel); comic books aren't just for boys, girls read it too. However, I have no interest in any Marvel movie due to my jaded attitude, so I prefer Marvel cartoons like 90s X-Men TAS and Avengers EMH. 
Those Marvel comics I love reading are New Warriors, X-Men, Young Avengers, X-Factor, Avengers (not that Bendis era), Generation X, Avengers Academy and X-Force. 
Big fan of New Warriors and X-Men. 
My Favourite Marvel characters are...GAMBIT (Remy LeBeau), JUBILEE (Jubilation Lee), SPEEDBALL (Robbie Baldwin), WICCAN (Billy Kaplan), JUSTICE (Vance Astrovik), ROGUE (Anna Marie), SPEED (Tommy Shepherd), NIGHTCRAWLER (Kurt Wagner), FIRESTAR (Angelica Jones), QUICKSILVER (Pietro Maximoff), SHE-HULK (Jennifer Walters), QUASAR (Wendell Vaughn) and COSMO the space dog.

summary: Gibbon (Martin Blank) is one of the most tragic antagonists in Spider-Man comics. Gibbon was born different as a mutant for...
caption:
Gibbon (Martin Blank) is one of the most tragic antagonists in Spider-Man comics. Gibbon was born different as a mutant for having facial features of an ape as well as having superhuman agility and strength. He spent his years being laughed at and treated like dirt by anyone. In his flashbacks before his death, Gibbon remembers the time when he met Spider-Man (Peter Parker) and asked him on a second meeting whether he could be a sidekick. In response to his request, Spider-Man laughed at the idea that Gibbon took it as an insult and tried to throttle him. Then, Spider-Man brushed him off and left Gibbon all alone which allowed Kraven to manipulate him into villainy. 

- Amazing Spider-Man v5 18.HU, 2019 (1st and 2nd pics)

- Amazing Spider-Man v1 #110, 1972 (4th, 5th, 6th, 7th and 8th pics)

summary: I get emotional when I think about Spiderverse because it’s so insane that it even exists?? There have been so many stumbling...
body: I get emotional when I think about Spiderverse because it’s so insane that it even exists?? There have been so many stumbling blocks for good animation due to Hollywood’s massive prejudices against it much less good animated movies where the protagonist is a minority and much much less a sweet, clever, human, and downright badass black boy? I pray to god that we get more movies as groundbreaking as this one in 2019.

I pray to god that we get more movies as groundbreaking as this one in 2019.

I pray to god that we get more movies as groundbreaking as this one in 2019.
trail.content: I get emotional when I think about Spiderverse because it’s so insane that it even exists?? There have been so many stumbling blocks for good animation due to Hollywood’s massive prejudices against it much less good animated movies where the protagonist is a minority and much much less a sweet, clever, human, and downright badass black boy? I pray to god that we get more movies as groundbreaking as this one in 2019.
